main event: A round, luminous object was sighted twice over the Chesapeake Bay in Maryland on March 12, 1955.
interesting points: During the second sighting, the luminous mass completely disappeared.
The object flew in a northwest direction, then reappeared from the southeast and drifted down towards the ground or water.
The duration of each individual observation was not specified in the report.
The description of the object's maneuvers was considered vague, and there was insufficient data for a proper evaluation.
